name: open-web-math/open-web-math
description: OpenWebMath represents an unprecedented achievement in data collection, offering a comprehensive dataset with a high concentration of mathematical text. With the dataset comprising 6.3 million documents containing 14.7 billion tokens, and sourced from over 200 billion HTML files on Common Crawl, OpenWebMath stands as a testament to the potential of what can be achieved by harnessing the wealth of information available on the internet. This dataset is particularly useful for pre-training and fine-tuning large language models, serving as an essential tool for those working in Natural Language Processing aimed at better understanding and modeling mathematical concepts and language.
citeAs: @misc{paster2023openwebmath,       title={OpenWebMath: An Open Dataset of High-Quality Mathematical Web Text},       author={Keiran Paster and Marco Dos Santos and Zhangir Azerbayev and Jimmy Ba},       year={2023},       eprint={2310.06786},       archivePrefix={arXiv},       primaryClass={cs.AI} }
creator: open-web-math
keywords: Web text data, math, NLP, Common Crawl
